destinationTable.description: The logs destination table name in LogAnalytics.

sqsUrls.description: The AWS sqs urls for the connector.

RestApiPollerDataConnector.description: Represents Rest Api Poller data connector.

properties.description: Rest Api Poller data connector properties.

RestApiPollerDataConnectorProperties.description: Rest Api Poller data connector properties.

connectorDefinitionName.description: The connector definition name (the dataConnectorDefinition resource id).

isActive.description: Indicates whether the connector is active or not.

addOnAttributes.description: The add on attributes. The key name will become attribute name (a column) and the value will become the attribute value in the payload.

rateLimitQPS.description: The Rate limit queries per second for the request..

queryWindowInMin.description: The query window in minutes for the request.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method, default value GET.

queryTimeFormat.description: The query time format. A remote server can have a query to pull data from range 'start' to 'end'. This property indicate what is the expected time format the remote server know to parse.
queryTimeFormat.example: UnixTimestamp, UnixTimestampInMills, or more specific formats, for example: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ

isPostPayloadJson.description: Flag to indicate if HTTP POST payload is in JSON format (vs form-urlencoded).

headers.description: The header for the request for the remote server.

queryParameters.description: The HTTP query parameters to RESTful API.

queryParametersTemplate.description: the query parameters template. Defines the query parameters template to use when passing query parameters in advanced scenarios.

startTimeAttributeName.description: The query parameter name which the remote server expect to start query. This property goes hand to hand with `endTimeAttributeName`.

endTimeAttributeName.description: The query parameter name which the remote server expect to end query. This property goes hand to hand with `startTimeAttributeName`

queryTimeIntervalAttributeName.description: The query parameter name which we need to send the server for query logs in time interval. Should be defined with `queryTimeIntervalPrepend` and `queryTimeIntervalDelimiter`

queryTimeIntervalPrepend.description: The string prepend to the value of the query parameter in `queryTimeIntervalAttributeName`.

queryTimeIntervalDelimiter.description: The delimiter string between 2 QueryTimeFormat in the query parameter `queryTimeIntervalAttributeName`.

RestApiPollerRequestPagingLinkHeaderConf.description: The request paging configuration for LinkHeader and PersistentLinkHeader paging type parameters.

linkHeaderTokenJsonPath.description: JSON path of link header token in HTTP response payload

linkHeaderRelLinkName.description: Rel link name from the link header

RestApiPollerRequestPagingTokenConfig.description: The request paging configuration for NextPageToken and PersistentToken paging type parameters.

nextPageTokenJsonPath.description: JSON path of next page token in HTTP response payload

hasNextFlagJsonPath.description: JSON path of flag in HTTP response payload to indicate more pages

nextPageTokenResponseHeader.description: HTTP response header name of next page token

nextPageParaName.description: Next page parameter name in HTTP request

nextPageRequestHeader.description: Next page header name in the request

RestApiPollerRequestPagingNextPageUrlCon.description: The request paging configuration for NextPageUrl paging type parameters.

nextPageUrlQueryParameters.description: Query parameters of next page URL

nextPageUrlQueryParametersTemplate.description: Paging query parameters in string template format

nextPageParaName.description: Next page parameter name in HTTP request

nextPageRequestHeader.description: Next page header name in the request

hasNextFlagJsonPath.description: JSON path of flag in HTTP response payload to indicate more pages

RestApiPollerRequestPagingOffsetConfig.description: The request paging configuration for Offset paging type parameters.

offsetParaName.description: Offset parameter name in HTTP request

RestApiPollerRequestPagingCountBaseConfi.description: The request paging configuration for Count base paging type parameters.

zeroBasedIndexing.description: Indicates whether the count is zero based

pageCountJsonPath.description: JSON path of page count in HTTP response payload

pageNumberParaName.description: Parameter name of page number in HTTP request

pageNumberJsonPath.description: JSON path of page number in HTTP response payload

totalResultsJsonPath.description: JSON path of total number of results in HTTP response payload

GCPDataConnector.description: Represents Google Cloud Platform data connector.

properties.description: Google Cloud Platform data connector properties.

GCPDataConnectorProperties.description: Google Cloud Platform data connector properties.

connectorDefinitionName.description: The name of the connector definition that represents the UI config.

auth.description: The auth section of the connector.

request.description: The request section of the connector.

dcrConfig.description: The configuration of the destination of the data.

GCPAuthProperties.description: Google Cloud Platform auth section properties.

serviceAccountEmail.description: The service account that is used to access the GCP project.

workloadIdentityProviderId.description: The workload identity provider id that is used to gain access to the GCP project.

GCPRequestProperties.description: Google Cloud Platform request section properties.

DCRConfiguration.description: The configuration of the destination of the data.

dataCollectionEndpoint.description: Represents the data collection ingestion endpoint in log analytics.

dataCollectionRuleImmutableId.description: The data collection rule immutable id, the rule defines the transformation and data destination.

streamName.description: The stream we are sending the data to.

ApiKeyAuthModel.description: Model for authentication with the API Key. Will result in additional header on the request (default behavior) to the remote server: 'ApiKeyName: ApiKeyIdentifier ApiKey'. If 'IsApiKeyInPostPayload' is true it will send it in the body of the request and not the header.
ApiKeyAuthModel.example: ApiKey = placeholderApiKey, ApiKeyName = 'Authorization', ApiKeyIdentifier = 'token', IsApiKeyInPostPayload = false. will result in a new header on the request: 'Authorization: token placeholderApiKey'

apiKey.description: API Key for the user secret key credential

isApiKeyInPostPayload.description: Flag to indicate if API key is set in HTTP POST payload

AWSAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication with AWS.

externalId.description: AWS STS assume role external ID. This is used to prevent the confused deputy problem: 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/confused-deputy.html'

BasicAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication with basic flow - user name + password.

GCPAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication for all GCP kind connectors.

GenericBlobSbsAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication for working with service bus or storage account.

credentialsConfig.description: Credentials for service bus namespace, keyvault uri for access key

storageAccountCredentialsConfig.description: Credentials for storage account, keyvault uri for access key

GitHubAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication for GitHub. For this authentication first we need to approve the Router app (Microsoft Security DevOps) to access the GitHub account, Then we only need the InstallationId to get the access token from https://api.github.com/app/installations/{installId}/access_tokens.

NoneAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication with no authentication method - public API.

JwtAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication with JWT. Simple exchange between user name + password to access token.

userName.description: The user name. If user name and password sent in header request we only need to populate the `value` property with the user name (Same as basic auth). If user name and password sent in body request we need to specify the `Key` and `Value`.

queryParameters.description: The custom query parameter we want to add once we send request to token endpoint.

headers.description: The custom headers we want to add once we send request to token endpoint.

isCredentialsInHeaders.description: Flag indicating whether we want to send the user name and password to token endpoint in the headers.

isJsonRequest.description: Flag indicating whether the body request is JSON (header Content-Type = application/json), meaning its a Form URL encoded request (header Content-Type = application/x-www-form-urlencoded).

OAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication with OAuth2.

clientSecret.description: The Application (client) secret that the OAuth provider assigned to your app.

clientId.description: The Application (client) ID that the OAuth provider assigned to your app.

isCredentialsInHeaders.description: Indicating whether we want to send the clientId and clientSecret to token endpoint in the headers.

scope.description: The Application (client) Scope that the OAuth provider assigned to your app.

redirectUri.description: The Application redirect url that the user config in the OAuth provider.

grantType.description: The grant type, usually will be 'authorization code'.

tokenEndpoint.description: The token endpoint. Defines the OAuth2 refresh token.

isJwtBearerFlow.description: A value indicating whether it's a JWT flow.

OracleAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication for Oracle.

SessionAuthModel.description: Model for API authentication with session cookie.

userName.description: The user name attribute key value.

queryParameters.description: Query parameters to session service endpoint.

isPostPayloadJson.description: Indicating whether API key is set in HTTP POST payload.

headers.description: HTTP request headers to session service endpoint.

sessionIdName.description: Session id attribute name from HTTP response header.

sessionLoginRequestUri.description: HTTP request URL to session service endpoint.

CcpResponseConfig.description: A custom response configuration for a rule.

eventsJsonPaths.description: The json paths, '$' char is the json root.

successStatusJsonPath.description: The value where the status message/code should appear in the response.

isGzipCompressed.description: The value indicating whether the remote server support Gzip and we should expect Gzip response.

format.description: The response format. possible values are json,csv,xml

csvDelimiter.description: The csv delimiter, in case the response format is CSV.

hasCsvBoundary.description: The value indicating whether the response has CSV boundary in case the response in CSV format.

hasCsvHeader.description: The value indicating whether the response has headers in case the response in CSV format.

convertChildPropertiesToArray.description: The value indicating whether the response isn't an array of events / logs.  By setting this flag to true it means the remote server will response with an object which each property has as a value an array of events / logs.

csvEscape.description: The character used to escape characters in CSV.

collectionId.description: The collection id of the TAXII server.

properties.description: IoT data connector properties.

properties.description: Codeless UI data connector properties

connectorUiConfig.description: Config to describe the instructions blade

customImage.description: An optional custom image to be used when displaying the connector within Azure Sentinel's connector's gallery

graphQueriesTableName.description: Name of the table the connector will insert the data to

graphQueries.description: The graph query to show the current data status

sampleQueries.description: The sample queries for the connector

dataTypes.description: Data types to check for last data received

connectivityCriteria.description: Define the way the connector check connectivity

DataConnectorConnectBody.description: Represents Codeless API Polling data connector.

kind.description: The authentication kind used to poll the data

apiKey.description: The API key of the audit server.

dataCollectionEndpoint.description: Used in v2 logs connector. Represents the data collection ingestion endpoint in log analytics.

dataCollectionRuleImmutableId.description: Used in v2 logs connector. The data collection rule immutable id, the rule defines the transformation and data destination.

outputStream.description: Used in v2 logs connector. The stream we are sending the data to, this is the name of the streamDeclarations defined in the DCR.

clientSecret.description: The client secret of the OAuth 2.0 application.

clientId.description: The client id of the OAuth 2.0 application.

authorizationCode.description: The authorization code used in OAuth 2.0 code flow to issue a token.

userName.description: The user name in the audit log server.

password.description: The user password in the audit log server.

CodelessApiPollingDataConnector.description: Represents Codeless API Polling data connector.

properties.description: Codeless poling data connector properties

ApiPollingParameters.description: Represents Codeless API Polling data connector

connectorUiConfig.description: Config to describe the instructions blade

pollingConfig.description: Config to describe the polling instructions

CodelessConnectorPollingConfigProperties.description: Config to describe the polling config for API poller connector

auth.description: Describe the authentication type of the poller

request.description: Describe the poll request config parameters of the poller

paging.description: Describe the poll request paging config of the poller

response.description: Describe the response config parameters of the poller

CodelessConnectorPollingResponseProperti.description: Describes the response from the external server

eventsJsonPaths.description: Describes the path we should extract the data in the response

successStatusJsonPath.description: Describes the path we should extract the status code in the response

successStatusValue.description: Describes the path we should extract the status value in the response

isGzipCompressed.description: Describes if the data in the response is Gzip

CodelessConnectorPollingPagingProperties.description: Describe the properties needed to make a pagination call

nextPageParaName.description: Defines the name of a next page attribute

nextPageTokenJsonPath.description: Defines the path to a next page token JSON

pageCountAttributePath.description: Defines the path to a page count attribute

pageTotalCountAttributePath.description: Defines the path to a page total count attribute

pageTimeStampAttributePath.description: Defines the path to a paging time stamp attribute

searchTheLatestTimeStampFromEventsList.description: Determines whether to search for the latest time stamp in the events list

pageSizeParaName.description: Defines the name of the page size parameter

CodelessConnectorPollingRequestPropertie.description: Describe the request properties needed to successfully pull from the server

apiEndpoint.description: Describe the endpoint we should pull the data from

queryWindowInMin.description: The window interval we will use the pull the data

httpMethod.description: The http method type we will use in the poll request, GET or POST

queryTimeFormat.description: The time format will be used the query events in a specific window

retryCount.description: Describe the amount of time we should try and poll the data in case of failure

timeoutInSeconds.description: The number of seconds we will consider as a request timeout

headers.description: Describe the headers sent in the poll request

queryParameters.description: Describe the query parameters sent in the poll request

queryParametersTemplate.description: For advanced scenarios for example user name/password embedded in nested JSON payload

startTimeAttributeName.description: This will be used the query events from a start of the time window

endTimeAttributeName.description: This will be used the query events from the end of the time window

CodelessConnectorPollingAuthProperties.description: Describe the authentication properties needed to successfully authenticate with the server

apiKeyName.description: The header name which the token is sent with

apiKeyIdentifier.description: A prefix send in the header before the actual token

isApiKeyInPostPayload.description: Marks if the key should sent in header

flowName.description: Describes the flow name, for example 'AuthCode' for Oauth 2.0

tokenEndpoint.description: The endpoint used to issue a token, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

authorizationEndpoint.description: The endpoint used to authorize the user, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

authorizationEndpointQueryParameters.description: The query parameters used in authorization request, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

redirectionEndpoint.description: The redirect endpoint where we will get the authorization code, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

tokenEndpointHeaders.description: The query headers used in token request, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

tokenEndpointQueryParameters.description: The query parameters used in token request, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

isClientSecretInHeader.description: Marks if we should send the client secret in header or payload, used in Oauth 2.0 flow

LastDataReceivedDataType.description: Data type for last data received

name.description: Name of the data type to show in the graph. can be use with {{graphQueriesTableName}} placeholder

lastDataReceivedQuery.description: Query for indicate last data received

resourceProvider.description: Resource provider permissions required for the connector

customs.description: Customs permissions required for the connector

Customs.description: Customs permissions required for the connector

CustomsPermission.description: Customs permissions required for the connector

ResourceProvider.description: Resource provider permissions required for the connector

InstructionSteps.description: Instruction steps to enable the connector

ConnectivityCriteria.description: Setting for the connector check connectivity

SampleQueries.description: The sample queries for the connector

GraphQueries.description: The graph query to show the current data status

metricName.description: the metric that the query is checking

baseQuery.description: The base query for the graph

DataConnectorsCheckRequirementsBody.description: The parameters for requirements check message
